standards.name: EBRD Environmental and Social Policy
standards.description: The EBRD Environmental and Social Policy sets out mandatory Performance Requirements for all EBRD investments. It covers environmental assessment, labor conditions, pollution prevention, community health and safety, land acquisition, biodiversity conservation, indigenous peoples, and cultural heritage.

standards.name: IFC Performance Standards
standards.description: The IFC Performance Standards define clients' responsibilities for managing their environmental and social risks. The standards are widely adopted by financial institutions globally and are considered the gold standard for sustainable finance.
key_requirements: PS1: Assessment and Management of Environmental and Social Risks and Impacts
PS3: Resource Efficiency and Pollution Prevention
PS4: Community Health, Safety, and Security
PS5: Land Acquisition and Involuntary Resettlement
PS6: Biodiversity Conservation and Sustainable Management of Living Natural Resources
standards.applicability: All IFC investments and projects using IFC standards

standards.name: EU Taxonomy for Sustainable Activities
standards.description: Classification system establishing a list of environmentally sustainable economic activities to help scale up sustainable investment and implement the European Green Deal. Sets performance thresholds for economic activities to be considered environmentally sustainable.
key_requirements: Substantial contribution to climate mitigation or adaptation
Do no significant harm to other environmental objectives
standards.applicability: EU-based projects and companies reporting under NFRD/CSRD

standards.name: Equator Principles
standards.description: Risk management framework adopted by financial institutions for determining, assessing and managing environmental and social risk in project finance. Based on IFC Performance Standards and used globally for project finance transactions.
